Reviews.Title: “Corp 'go to' now available to public”
Reviews.Author: BrianJ30
Reviews.Content: Same quiet professional environment and service as Club Quarters Opposite Rockefeller Center because it is the same hotel. Apparently they opened some floors to public reservations under the Manhattan Centre name. If you are looking for a quiet hide-away literally right on top of Rockefeller Center and walking distance from Broadway, 5th Ave shops, etc., this is it.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised”
Reviews.Author: Brian W
Reviews.Content: The lobby was a bit small but when I went to my room it was very clean and comfortable. My girlfriend is a bit fussy but she had a wonderful time and loved walking to times square. The staff were so helpful and friendly.....definitely coming back this summer!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant stay!”
Reviews.Author: TravelgirlMalibu
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel in late December 2011 and was very pleased with the experience. Well-kept, clean and GREAT LOCATION!! Only one negative - WiFi was intermittent at best. Overall, highly recommended when staying in Manhattan.

Reviews.Title: “Good Experience, Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: tipp21
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night.....the location is excellent....had double room on 17th floor was spacious and great view!!....other people staying with us had suite with small kitchen very large room great for a family....overall enjoyed the hotel and it exceeded our expectations...would stay here again :)

Reviews.Title: “Still like this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: rgi58
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel again. For the price, its a great value. The rooms are clean and well-kept and the staff is friendly and helpful. The location is great. . Its near the subway. And they provide free bottled water. I plan to go back again when I travel next to NY.

Reviews.Title: “Expected more from this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lovetraveling85
Reviews.Content: We arrived at 4pm and we were told our room wasn't ready, could we come back later... We asked how long as we'd had a long trip from the Uk. We were told an hour or so. Not a good start.2 hours later... Went to our room, and to our disbelief the room was covered in dust and not a few days worth, this was weeks worth, not exactly sure what they were cleaning. Room was small as expected for NY but modern. In general staff were friendly but lacked in modesty. New York itself was lovely, had an amazing time. We went to Teresa's cafe for breakfast as others suggested, was ok, a little on the expensive side. Would rather spend the same amount of money in a coffee shop, try Pret-a-manger on broadway. Worth buying the city pass if you're gonna visit the usual tourist attractions, works out cheaper.

Reviews.Title: “Location was perfect”
Reviews.Author: Iluv2travel61
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel was perfect. Rockefeller Center and Radio City Music Hall are right outside the door.Broadway and Times Square were only two blocks away .The subway was right around the corner which made getting around quick and easy. The room was clean and a decent size. There is a deli right outside the door which was great for breakfast or snacks. The staff was very friendly. We arrived too early to check in so the staff checked our bags for the day and did not charge us like other hotels do. The free bottled water was also a treat ! I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent experience”
Reviews.Author: lilysouthcarolina
Reviews.Content: Very nice modern room, reasonable size on 12th floor, complimentary coffee in Terrace Cafe in mornings (not advertised) along with comp. bottled water located on several floors next to elevator. Very secure hotel as keycard required for elevator. Great location and we experienced excellent service from staff. Terrance cafe is nice and relaxing on 7th floor inside or outside with computers and printer for boarding passes. Bid on priceline at good value for stay on 10/24/11; otherwise, Manhattan hotels very expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: kathy j
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 days in October at the Manhattan Center Hotel. The staff was wonderful and accomodating. They made us feel like VIPs. We were invited to the Terrace for happy hour while on the elevater with the hostess. She was so friendly that we could not refuse. The waitstaff heard that we were celebrating 2 birthdays (grandmother and granddaughter) and showed up with a birthday cheesecake. The front desk staff treated us like we were the only one with questions and answered each of them clearly. The Hotel is across the street from Rockefeller Centre and within walking distance of Time Square. The rooms may have been a little small but were very clean. Who wants to spend a lot of time in the room anyway? We loved the place and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, basic hotel”
Reviews.Author: Paristraveller62
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in May 2011. The best thing about the hotel is its location. Just opposite Rockefeller Centre, seconds from 5th Ave and few minutesâ€™ walk from Times Square. The hotel has a tiny, almost invisible street entrance with no real facilities downstairs. Some members of the staff were very helpful and polite, but some others almost rude. Upon my arrival I was placed in a very small, dark, very noisy and not so clean room on the 10th floor facing the back yard. I immediately asked to move me on an upper floor, and they gave me a better room on the 20th floor, where I had a nice stay for 5 days. In general, it is a nice basic hotel, clean and in good price for its location in the center of Manhattan. Ideal for someone who needs only a place to sleep, and more time walking around. The breakfast was good but in my opinion overpriced. It was better to have something in the numerous very nice places just next or around the hotel. There were computers available for guests in the club lounge area upstairs as well as bottles of water. Both free of charge. The free internet in room was useful, but not so fast at times.

Reviews.Title: “Just a Place to Crash...”
Reviews.Author: USAISMYHOME
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Manhattan Centre hotel for one night, which was far too long. I was looking for a large hotel room with a kitchen, sofa and desk. That was literally what I received. First I have never stayed at a hotel in which I must use a room key to activate the elevator. This was simply nuts and confusing. The hotel and rooms are small, very small, extremely small. They say it is a â€œEuropeanâ€� styled room, but Iâ€™ve traveled Europe extensively and even for their standards this room was small. The couch had two big stains on them. YUCK! But for an added convenience the sofa bed was right next to the â€œKitchen.â€� Sarcasm. There was no bathroom door, but instead a sliding â€œdoor,â€� that did not lock and you could hear and see everything that went on in the bathroom. The door was not a solid wooden door, but was a frosted glass door. The sink was outside the bathroom which I was not expecting. The tv was a joke, about the size of a small kitchen tv. The phone was a basic cordless phone. In order to have ice you have to go to the second floor and obtain an ice bucket, as there wasnâ€™t one in the room. Probably for lack of space. The air conditioner did not work properly and kept clicking in the middle of the night. Also, the air conditioning unit was broken. And the ipod dock that is referenced is no dock at all. It is a small radio clock that has a cord that you can plug your ipod or iphone into. Additionally, when I confirmed my reservation I requested a room with a view of the plaza, or the city skyline. Something, anything nice with a view. What I received instead was a crisp clean view of the building next door cement siding. I felt duped to say the least. And when I called down the next morning to request a late check out, (check out is at 12), they stated it was an additional $30 or $35 dollars for each half hour after noon. Also, the room charge when I checked out was different than what appeared on my credit card statement and I am disputing the additional charges. Use an amex when reserving this room as it seems they excessively ask and swipe your card. I have never stayed in a place like this before and trust me will never stay in this place ever again. For what they charged and what you actually receive there are far better spots in NYC to stay. Stay here at your own risk.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: nialldinho
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in Sept 2010. The best thing about the hotel is it's location. It was perfect for us - right at Rockefeller Centre, seconds from 5th Ave and 5 minutes from Times Square. The subway was also just around the corner. The room itself was small and a bit dark but it was fine for New York when you only need a place to sleep! The walls seemed a bit thin but the noise was never loud enough to keep us awake. There were computers available for guests in the club lounge area upstairs as well as bottles of water. Both free of charge.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, fantastic location and very helpful and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: PinkladyBarcelona
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel due to its location and we were not disappointed. We had the New York Pass and had a lot of things to see and do in just five days. Due to the central location we were able to see and do a lot. The breakfast is not great but we got lucky and discovered a delicious diner just about a block away, not far from the MOMA.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: NBJenny
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel during our very first trip to NYC. We chose the hotel based on price and location and were very pleased. We flew JetBlue out of Portland, ME to JFK and took a yellow cab to the hotel. This was our first time with JetBlue and we really enjoyed the airline and would fly it again without hesitation. The check-in process took about 2 minutes and our room was ready early (we arrived around 10:30 a.m.) which we took advantage of for a fee of $35. Staff is very friendly and helpful with directions, advice, etc. The rooms are small but efficient and clean. Beds are comfortable and high speed internet is free. We had a room on the third floor and though others have complained about noise, our room was very quiet and we slept soundly every night. There was no tub in our room, just a shower stall which was fine with us. We tipped housekeeping a few bucks each day and got whatever we requested (extra pillows, towels, etc) and they always left us a thank you note. The location of the hotel is fantastic and the number one reason why we will be returning here on our next visit. It's just across the street from Radio City Music Hall and a short walk from Times Square and Central Park. There are two cafe's within steps from the hotel that serve excellent breakfasts and lunch for very reasonable prices. We ate at Angela's Rock & Roll Deli near Central Park and it was excellent and cheap. Also, Bravo Pizza had the best pizza we've ever had. Virgil's BBQ is also excellent. Planet Hollywood had great Happy Hour specials in the afternoon including delicious $6 cosmos (shout out to bartender Guy who was very friendly and gave great advice about things to do and see). The best meal we had in the city was at Trattoria Trecolori. It is an excellent Italian restaurant with superb, professional staff and amazing food. For $100 we got three courses and two drinks. Excellent. Also worth mentioning: the cupcakes at Magnolia Bakery in Grand Central were SO good! We went to Cirque Du Soleil's Zarkana, Wicked and a Yankees game. All were excellent and well worth the money. We had the New York Pass which we thought was great. We avoided long lines a couple of times and took part in the following tours/attractions: Empire State Building (did this at night; it's not as good as Top of the Rock but probably a must do anyway); Top of the Rock; Circle Line Tours; Madame Tussaud's; Museum of Natural History. These were included in the pass. We figured we saved about $50 each with the pass. We also visited Grand Central ( a must) and Ripley's Believe it or Not (skip it) as well as the Central Park Zoo (skip it). We found New Yorkers to be great people. Friendly, respectful and helpful. We felt safe, even in the subway, and felt totally comfortable walking around the city at any hour. We used Carmel's car service on the way back to the airport and would highly recommend. They were there early, the van was clean and the trip was smooth. The fee was $63 plus tolls and tip. Can't wait for our next trip to NYC! Happy travels!!

Reviews.Title: “LOUD- No sleep the first night there!!!”
Reviews.Author: NaLe
Reviews.Content: While this hotel has a good location, the staff is friendly and it is relatively clean, the most important thing they lack is sound-proofing. The first night there we had a room on the 2nd floor facing the street. The street noise was bearable, but there is a club in the basement of the same building and since it was a Friday night, the music was blaring so much, all we could hear was loud beats and lyrics to the songs, It was terrible! So the next day we complained and got another room on the sixth floor, however this one was right next to the gym, so anytime anybody would use any of the machines it was quite loud. Luckily nobody used the gym during the night, but they should at least keep it locked during nighttime so to be considerate of other guests on that floor. Overall, I would never stay here again nor would I recommend it to any of my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great to stay at. Very clean. Will be back”
Reviews.Author: rgi58
Reviews.Content: Great location. Very clean room and friendly staff. Will definitly return.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel! Very friendly and attentive Staff.”
Reviews.Author: JessFord03
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel and will definitely stay there again. The staff was very friendly and attentive and the the hotel itself was extremely clean! I would suggest this hotel to anyone who is looking for a great place to stay in New York! You also get a great view of the city from the restaurant!

Reviews.Title: “OK hotel for the money you pay”
Reviews.Author: vantooren
Reviews.Content: the only wonderful thing about this hotel is location. great location. in the heart of manhattan, close by subway. the rooms are very small, and noisy. noisy from the airco that is located on top of the building and also - on the middle level. we wanted to change the rooms and tried a couple , on different levels - all had same level of noise. so if you are not very sensible to this - then no problem. otherwise - limited service ( i.e. no umbrellas to rent if it rains, just 1 restaurant on the 7th floor) - but this is a minor issue, because just next to the hotel there are wonderful bistro-s to have great breakfast, or shops to buy all you need. so if you go to NY to spend a long weekend and intend to mostly spend time outside of the hotel - then Manhattan Centre is a fine hotel as long as you pay twice less than for the hotels in the neighbourhood.

Reviews.Title: “A good choice for NY, but average by world standards”
Reviews.Author: BerlitzTraveller
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is located on W51st St, between 5th and 6th Avenue, two doors down from its sister property, The Pearl. You can check in and out at either hotel, regardless of which one you are staying in. This is a very good choice for NY if location is your priority, and don't expect a memorable hotel experience. Rocerfeller Centre is across the road, The Empire State building is 17blocks away, and Central Park 10. We chose a one bedroom studio with kitchenette. The room was adequate, although starting to show some signs of wear, most notably in the bathroom. Whilst it was clean and comfortable, it by no means equates to what you get for a similar amount in other parts of the US, and indeed the world. Reception is a DIY kiosk affair, with only two kiosks, it can get a little crowded. Luggage storage is available on departure, but be aware that when you return to claim your bags you need to give staff at least 10mins notice for same to be retrieved, as they are held off site (most probably at The Pearl). Our room was serviced daily, and we had no cause to approach the staff for anything. The hotel served its puropse, in that it was somewhere clean and comfortable to sleep, and I daresay good value in NYC, but it was largely forgettable.

Reviews.Title: “Bad Experience”
Reviews.Author: Andre_Faria
Reviews.Content: Me and my girlfriend stayed at the Manhattan centre, also called "Club Quarters opposite to rockfeller center". My stay was very nice until I noticed that my grilfriend's purse was missing. This was a purse that she had bought a day before for someone else, since she has a store in back in our country especialised in purses. I told the hotel the purse was missing and they said that it didn't happened and they trusted the staff even though I told them that I was sure that the purse was missing. Suming up, too bad the people was so unprepared to treat this problem. Be careful so it won't happen to you since the room don't have a safe.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, location and cleanliness.”
Reviews.Author: SanAntonioBill
Reviews.Content: This ones hard to beat. Seriously great location in midtown, clean and good price. Drawbacks? This is New York - rooms are smallish, mini-gym insufficient, postage stamp lobby (can get hectic during mass check-in/check-out). - otherwise, for less than you'd pay at a La Quinta in Ft. Worth you're in the heart of the worlds most exciting city!

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: janiep2011
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just visited NYC for the first time and stayed at this location. Initially, we had a 2nd story room which did not have a view, but the concierge happily accommodated our request. We also found that the room was clean and free of bed bugs...we pulled apart the room to be sure and it was clean. Additionally, we loved the location because it was close to Rockefellar Center, Central Park, and Times Square. Also, there is a great diner called Teresa's that has an excellent breakfast and lunch menu at extremely affordable prices. We never even went to the hotel's restaurant because Teresa's was excellent!! One negative of the hotel was the elevators which were a little slow, but other than that we have no complaints..we will definitely stay here again on our next NYC visit.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: artymom
Reviews.Content: We were really pleased with our stay here and never knew about this place. We got the room on Priceline. The room was contemporary, not tiny, with a terrific bathroom. The room had great light and was very quiet. We had a view of Saint Patricks Cathedral and the hotel is perpendicular to Rockefeller Center.....great location We would stay here again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Centrally located!”
Reviews.Author: TheEclecticEve
Reviews.Content: I got this on-line deal because I knew that New York hotels are expensive. If you're a couple visiting NYC, I recommend this hotel! This is a small boutique hotel and rooms are small but it was clean, with free wi-fi, bed are comfortable and walking distance to everywhere in Manhattan. It is very central. Subway station is right around the corner too.

Reviews.Title: “Know a few things in advance and you'll be okay”
Reviews.Author: MidwestPhotog
Reviews.Content: Room design and layout is good. It was quiet the whole time we were there. Room and hallways were clean. Magnifying mirror in the bathroom is a great touch. Wireless in the room and Floor 2 computer/printer for printing boarding pass is nice. Customer service from receptionists is hit or miss. When we arrived at the hotel they sent us down to the Jewel (their "sister") which was fine but a bit off-putting upon arrival. AC unit spewed disgusting odor which I reported five times (wish this were an exaggeration but it is not) before anything was done about it. This is unacceptable. Eventually it was fixed. Bed is hard and bedding is not luxury by any means. Comforter is impractical, too small, and slips off.

Reviews.Title: “Lucky we got a deal on Hotwire...”
Reviews.Author: fintan12410
Reviews.Content: If we hadn't gotten an amazing deal on Hotwire for this place, I would be TICKED! This was by far the weirdest hotel I have ever stayed in. First, when we walked in, we were bombarded by the receptionist for our credit card for their "quick check in." Okay, fine. Mind you, this was in their lobby that is the size of our bedroom at home. Then we were given our keys and told that we needed them to operate the elevator. Oooohkay. I guess they're trying to keep us safe. Whatever. We go up to our room which was small but to be expected in New York and found that we had no remote control for the TV and couldn't get the air conditioning to work. Also, beware, there are no hair dryers in the rooms! I am not a fussy bed person, I can fall asleep pretty much on command but, man were these beds uncomfortable - hard as a rock! Also, I found the showers a little dorm-like. I commented to my boyfriend that I felt the need for shower shoes. There were also yellow splatters on the wall in the bathroom but we won't go there. I found a Fairfield Inn in Dayton, Ohio to be far more comfortable than the Manhattan Centre Hotel. 4 stars??? Seriously????

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: doroti_s
Reviews.Content: Very nice, clean, comfortable rooms. Incredible staff

Reviews.Title: “Well-priced, comfortable base for an NYC adventure.”
Reviews.Author: The_YTT
Reviews.Content: The hotel was half the price of a similar midrange hotel. The rooms were big and comfortable and the location is great.

Reviews.Title: “Great location BUT...”
Reviews.Author: podamus13
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked this hotel online for a long weekend and first trip to NYC. Our travel dates were 05/13 through 05/15. We arrived early on Friday (approximately 10:00 am) and I figured we'd have to leave our bags with a bellman and go about our day, but I was informed that there was a room available for a $35.00 early check in fee. Honestly, it was worth it to freshen up and be settled so we could be out all day with no worries! The location of the hotel is wonderful - between 5th and 6th Avenues. Rockefeller Center and Radio City are right across the road, which makes it easy access for the NBC Studio Tour, Top of The Rock and the skating rink area. The lower concourse of Rockefeller Center has shopping and restaurants, as well as access to a few of the subway lines (D.F.B,M). The Gershwin Theatre is about a 5 minute walk on 51st (about two blocks) and had the show Wicked there. I wished I would have known that before because seeing a show so close to the hotel would have been nice after a long day of sightseeing! Next door is a small restaurant called Theresa's, one side is a pizza place and the other makes sandwiches and coffee. We went there every morning to grab a coffee and chocolate danish and everyone there was friendly and wonderful! There isn't much sitting room, so be prepared to grab your chow and eat as you go. There is also a restaurant at the concourse level of the hotel, which is called Johnny Utahâ€™s. We didnâ€™t go because it seemed to serve just bar food and cater to the 21 crowdâ€¦not our style. Generally, we found the location perfect for getting around and seeing the tourist sights. Now on to the less than happy moments.... When we did our early check in I asked â€œplease make it a good room because this is our first trip to NYCâ€� and the front desk man said â€œOh yes, this is a good oneâ€�. Not quite - on the forth floor, facing the back of another building with a view of offices. The room itself was very small. There was one small chair by the bed, a little desk in one corner and a window in the other that was kind of separated by a large poll. Okay, I can deal with strange layouts, after all Iâ€™m there to pretty much shower and sleep. We also had a mini fridge and microwave, which I would guess constituted their idea of a â€œgood roomâ€�. The bath has only a shower, which was fine until I looked up and saw the corners had spider webs and some type of stuff in there tooâ€¦.I certainly didnâ€™t feel like cleaning and honestly couldnâ€™t anyway because they give you two body towels, one hand and two face - thatâ€™s it and nothing more. They were also the hardest towels I have ever scraped across my face and body! The bed was hard, and I mean really hard! So, if you think your going to some fluffy comfy room this isnâ€™t the case. My biggest problem was with the staff on two occasions. 1.) Saturday night we had a fire alarm at 3:00 a.m. and as if that isnâ€™t enough to scare the living daylights out of you, you also couldnâ€™t understand what in the world they were saying.! It was this horrible blaring sound followed by â€œThis is the Hotel Fire Director mumble mumble mumbleâ€�. I really felt for the neighboring rooms because they were foreign and had no idea what was being said either, and it wasnâ€™t like I could help. After about an hour it was said by some guests that there was a false alarm, BUT there was no announcement!!!!! I was angry and completely awakeâ€¦hereâ€™s my last day on my vacation and Iâ€™m going to be tired grouchy. Thanks!!!! 2.) We checked our bags with the bell to go enjoy our last day. I was told that when we came back it would take about 10 minutes to retrieve themâ€¦â€¦NOT! We got to the hotel at 4:00 pm., watched countless people get their bags till about 4:30 (I was trying to be patient knowing Iâ€™m already irritable). I asked if our bags would be up soon and was told â€œyes, they are on their wayâ€�. Another woman was waiting and she apparently wasnâ€™t as patient and asked if they were coming from LaGuardiaâ€¦.LOL. About 10 minutes more and the same front desk man says in an almost condescending tone to us â€œIs there something else I can do for you?â€� to which I responded â€œHow about get my bags?â€� and he pointed to ONE black bag and said â€œIsnâ€™t that it?â€� and Iâ€™ll cut to the chaseâ€¦he scrambled to figure out by radio where our FOUR bags were, gave us a hotel room key to go to the second floor and help find our bags (really?), which my husband did and we finally left - running all the way to the subway to catch our flightâ€¦.another Thanks Manhattan Centre Hotel!!!! I could pick apart a few other things, but I think this is enough of a ramble! So, to sum this up: 1) Great location and relatively clean. 2.) The staff we dealt with is seriously lacking in basic customer relation skills!

Reviews.Title: “This was not a four star hotel as expected.”
Reviews.Author: firstfruits
Reviews.Content: I'm writing this review because I'm a travel agent who recommended a guest to book there. The guest overall enjoyed the stay (even though the rooms were small, no bath tub only a shower) but the guest stated the hotel was more less a 2.5 star instead of a four star hotel The hotel location was excellent . The disapontment came also as guest checked in the first night and was informed that a $50 cash only deposit was needed each night even though the entire hotel reservation was paid in full online. Being the personal travel agent for guest I tried three times to call in to comment but always got an answering machine when asked to speak to management for feedback. That's why I decided to write this review. This is the first review I ever had to write about a hotel Our guest would not chose this hotel again and we would not recommend this hotel to our guest in the future. Hotel stay was April 20-april 25, 2011 My email address is tinysplace2003@yahoo.com just in case hotel management need to know the thoughts from a travel agent.

Reviews.Title: “Small But Perfectly Formed and What a Great Location !!”
Reviews.Author: HilaryMousley
Reviews.Content: Booked this Hotel on Hotwire and what an amazing stroke of luck ! Stayed 2 nights 24 to 26 April pre transatlantic cruise back home to UK. The Hotel was in an amazing location right adjacent to 5th Avenue and by the Rockefeller Centre. Checked Tripadvisor reviews which were very good and as per a review recommendation emailed the Hotel requesting room 2202 which was 1 of 3 balcony rooms on the 22nd floor. Room 2202 was perfect - small but perfect. with a wonderful view of St Patricks Cathedral. Beautifully clean modern bathroom with very good shower and excellent selection of luxury complimentary toiletries. Complimentary coffee and tea plus the chilled water bottle filling station certainly helped the dollars along. Highly recommend Theresa's Deli next door - amazing menu and value.........don't waste time looking anywhere else for breakfast !! Highly recommend the breakfast wraps for $4.95 and served by far the best coffee around. Bills Burger Bar over the road was also very good and very reasonable when the legs won't take you back out for dinner ! Don't be put off by previous reviews comments re slow lift - we did not have a problem. Don't be put off by previous reviews comments re small reception lobby - it was fine. The Hotel frontage is small so take care as it is easy to miss it.

Reviews.Title: “The Filipino lady receptionist SUCKS!!!”
Reviews.Author: Seem08
Reviews.Content: The receptionist made us wait forever eventhough the room was ready the night before coz i phoned the midnight receptionist & he confirmed that our allocated room is vacant & already clean but when we arrived from a very exhausting journey this lady receprionist just didn't care & acted as if she was struggling w/ the system because apparently it was down ( well as per her) but when she saw me doing this review she then decided to check us in!!! I was at the lobby sleeping, exhausted & too tired to go out & eat & this stupid receptionist didn't have the bone to care!!!

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away”
Reviews.Author: ts_6_78
Reviews.Content: We had a poor experience at this hotel. The location is great, but other than that, the experience while we were actually at the hotel was very poor. The bathrooms were the tiny, and the service was terrible. The fire alarm went off repeatedly for 30 minutes at night interrupting our sleep. The restaurant on site had the worst service of any restaurant that I have ever attended. We ended up checking out a night early because of the bad experience. The service from the concierge desk was also terrible. There are other comparably priced hotels in a convenient mid-town location that will treat you better.

Reviews.Title: “Couldnt have been any better”
Reviews.Author: shatzee7
Reviews.Content: 1st trip to New York and was much more than I ever expected. Perfect location allowed us to do many memorable things in our short visit. Only regret is we didnt stay longer.

Reviews.Title: “ideal”
Reviews.Author: woopwoopEnglandUk
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in the perfect location to explore new york. We pretty much walked everywhere - central park, empire state building, grand central station, times square. The rockafeller centre is on the doorstep - we literally crossed the road to admire the beautiful xmas tree. The hotel was clean and the bed extremely comfy! Having read other reviews we expected our room to be tiny. However, this was not the case at all although there is limited wardrobe/drawer space. The lift is a nightmare but luckily we werent high up so we took the stairs.

Reviews.Title: “A Midtown Gem”
Reviews.Author: swoot_uk
Reviews.Content: After spending far too long reviewing hotels in Manhattan, we narrowed it down to five or six in the midtown district which is where we wanted to stay. An hour later and the Manhattan Centre Hotel ticked the boxes and had good reviews, we booked the next day. We had requested a high room with good views if possible as the trip was to celebrate a birthday but unsure if this would be forwarded to the hotel or indeed acted upon. On arrival at the hotel in a yellow cab from JFK that took 30 mins and cost $45 plus tolls, we checked in at reception which as others have noted is quite small but perfectly adequate. The receptionist was very helpful and checked us in using one of the two check in stations, this provides your room key cards that also provide access to the lifts. We had no issues with the lifts and found them fast and efficient, unlike some other reviewers. In fact it took about 30 seconds to travel from ground to the 25th floor - fast enough for most I think. The hotel room was great, the hotel had received our request and gave us a room on a high floor with good views towards Radio City. The room was clean, modern and spacious enough for two of us on a five night break. There was a flatscreen TV with many channels, tea/coffee making facilities and access to free bottled water on every 'even' floor e.g. 24/26 etc. The bed was very comfortable and temperature control available in the room that worked quite well. No problems with the bathroom and shower, plenty of hot water always available and good pressure too. Again, very clean indeed. The hotel boasts 'The Terrace Club' on the 7th floor which has a bar area, relaxing chairs, restaurant eating area's (inside and out) and three pc's with complimentary internet access - great for using tripadvisor to review restaurants for the nights meal out! The food in The Terrace Club was very good indeed and we enjoyed breakfast in there a couple of times, the staff and service were faultless. Overall, a really good find and we will not hesitate in returning to this hotel on our next visit, a common theme with many other reviews on here.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have picked a better Location”
Reviews.Author: tsandrat
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location right next to Rockafeller Plaza. Easy to walk out of hotel and see many of the sights on foot. We expected to travel by cab but due tpo great central loctaion we walked miles and saw loads. A smallish , boutique size hotel- we requested room 2202- the only floor with balconies and got a great double room with views of the NYC skyline. Don't bother eating here- there are delis, coffee shops and diners all nearby- "Theresa's" next door do a good brekfast on the hoof, and I recommend breakfast in the Dining Concourse in Grand Central Terminal- about a 15min walk away. The empire state building and Macys are about 20-30mins away, and Times Square about 10 mins away. Head up 5th/6th Ave and Central Park is 30mins away. NO faults with the hotel- they look after your luggage once you check out , which is good if you have an evening flight. They also offer a very reliable Car Service- we booked it and paid $70 to Newark- it cost $35 on arrival by train and cab. Will definitley re book this for our next visit to The Big Apple

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, great base for a trip to the Big Apple”
Reviews.Author: DANANDCHRISTINA
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to New York and found the Hotel to be an ideal base for the adventure that is New York. It is literally a five minute walk to time square, empire state building, Broadway and Fifth Avenue. Very clean spacius rooms with a good view of New York, friendly helpful staff, and a great deli next door for breakfast. If we are lucky enough to return we will stay in the Manhattan Centre Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location, great staff”
Reviews.Author: Orphie27
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to NYC and we requested a room in the front of the hotel on an upper level so we would have a view. They gave us just what we wanted. We could see Radio City Music Hall in one direction and St. Patrick's Cathedral in the other direction with the Rockefeller Center in front. Staff was great with directions and suggestions. We were close to everything. Teresa's next door had great made to order breakfast. Bill's Bar and Burger just down the street had one of the best burgers I have ever tasted (and get their chili fries too). Be sure to stop at Juniors for cheesecake.

Reviews.Title: “Very Happy With This Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: scoobyju1
Reviews.Content: Just back from New York where I stayed at the Manhattan Centre Hotel. I was very pleased with the hotel & it's staff. My room was of a good size. The double bed was very comfortable (probably the best sleep i've had in a hotel). There was a small fridge, a coffee machine & a flat screen tv. Bathroom was kept clean. Free WiFi in the rooms. I noticed, I didn't get any noise from other guests but maybe that was just where my room was situated. Great location. Just off 5th Ave, opposite Radio City & Rockerfeller Square/Plaza. Subway station just around the corner & Central Park within walking distance. Customer service was good. I had left my room key in my room. No problem, they sorted me out with a replacement straight away. When I asked for advice, they were happy to offer it & you can store your bags after checkout until later in the day. My only gripe (and something that I think is mentioned in another review) was the speed of the elevators. Considering there were two of them, they were awfully slow. At times, I just took the stairs (I was staying on the 4th floor) I would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a fantastic area”
Reviews.Author: ebbyWales
Reviews.Content: I have just got back from the Manhattan Centre Hotel and i have to say you will not be disappointed. The location was spot on. Turning left out of hotel you are on fifth avenue, and to the right you can head for either Times Square and Central Park. Its across the road from Radio City and just one block from Rockefeller Centre. Our Check in was very quick, all done by computer. We only tried the Bar in the hotel once and found that very expensive and didn't try the food at all. There are a couple of places either side of the hotel where you can grab some breakfast. The rooms are quite big for New York standard. We had tea/coffee machine in room as well as a fridge and microwave. Hotel also offers free WIFI which was fab, can surf to your hearts content when returning back to your room after a day sightseeing. Beds were very comfy and the rooms were always clean. We had no view from the hotel window, only offices, but you don't go to New York to look at view from hotel. They have a fitness place there if you fancy more exercise!! If you ask me walking round New York is enough!! On our day of checking out, our flight wasn't till late at night but hotel was very helpful. They offer late checkout for an additional fee, and they also have somewhere where you can leave your luggage if you want to get some last minute shopping before leaving New York. Checkout was again no problems. Will definitely stop at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel in an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: NJeane-
Reviews.Content: Our family of four stayed in this hotel for 7 nights last October and we were very pleased with the hotel itself and the service. We had some trouble with the rooms because of using two different online booking systems but the situation was handled well. Our first room was for four people but it was much bigger than the second room, which on the other hand was much warmer than the bigger room. The rooms were clean and all in all very nice. You can't really expect to get a huge room in NYC if you don't pay more. Both of the rooms had a kitchenette which was very convenient since breakfast wasn't included in the price of the room. The only thing that might bother someone was the bahtroom door. It was actually a sliding door that left about 1 cm gaps between the door and the wall on both sides of the door, so that might be uncomfortable if you're not traveling with people you know well. The location of the hotel was perfect. It was next to Rockefeller Center's shops and in a walking distance from Times Square, Macy's etc. It was basically in the middle of everything. There were lots of places to eat near and the street wasn't the busiest one. The staff was friendly and it was nice that they spoke clearly so that it was easy for foreigners to communicate. The only negative thing is that we went to the reception to ask for a toothbrush and a towel (one piece of our luggage didn't arrive) and we never got those even though we were promised that those would be delivered to our room. We enjoyed our stay at this hotel and we'd definitely recommend staying here. I can't really find anything hugely negative, it's a quiet, clean hotel in a prime location.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: cdnglobetrotter007
Reviews.Content: I went with a friend of mine for a girls trip to NYC. We'd done this trip 2 years ago and had had a good experience with another hotel, but this one was more central so we thought we'd try it. It was AWESOME. The location is central - we rarely took the subway, despite the heat wave we experienced while we were in the city. We had a room on the 19th floor and it was plenty big for 2 people, and bigger than I expected for New York. The place was clean, it had A/C, and it offers free wireless and free internet for its guests. It also offeres guests free bottled water, both of which I think are really nice touches because other places would charge you for both. The room was quiet, the bed was comfortable, and the TV was nice (it was nice to have that when we were winding down from shopping and sight-seeing). The ONLY thing that bugged me was that the elevators (there are 2) were slow. But that was IT, and it wasn't even a big deal. I'd go back again and I'd recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “I expected the room to be small but i didn't expect it to be taller than it was wide.”
Reviews.Author: emotomom
Reviews.Content: I expected the room to be small but i didn't expect it to be taller than it was wide. I had to upgrade to a "superior" room because I was traveling with two teenagers and was told that We would have a room with a queen bed and a double bed. When we got there, we were given a room with a queen and a double pull out bed and were told that there were no room in the hotel that had the combination of beds which was described to us. The lobby was vry small as we expected and we were at first disappointed with a room on the third floor but were later relieved as the elevators were extremely slow making the stairs our choice to move between floors, even up to the 7th floor dining room. The staff was very young and a little condescending. They had little knowledge of how to get around the city by bus or subway (our preferred mode whenever we travel to big cities) and suggested that we cab it everywhere. We figured it out ourselves and were able to make use of public transportation without difficulty. The room as it turned out was a "junior suite" and had a fridge and microwave. The bathroom lack a properly closing door, but was a loosely hung sliding door which banged every time it was moved. It was fairly clean with modest amenities. The view from the room was poor. When I said it was taller than it was wide, I wasn't kidding. The room had a loft ceiling. There was one foot clearance between the foot of the pull-out bed and the wall. Good thing my teenagers are slim! The best part about this hotel is the location. It is across from the Rockefeller Center, near Times Square and subway station. Its prime location is the only reason to stay in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: nickolx
Reviews.Content: Having read all the reviews I arrived at this hotel with my expectations set at a level that I wouldn't be too surprised about the rooms, but after check in ( which took about 20 mins, too long in my books) I was pretty happy with the room. Knowing that it was going to be small, it was actually quite liveable in. The amenities are all good and the room was serviced well each day. This really is a good location, close to many things, but also not in the thick of things. It was an easy walk back from times square each night and good for meetings in the midtown area. Would recommend to family and friends and would be happy to stay there next time

Reviews.Title: “I do not know how they got 4 stars. poor quality hotel albeit good ;ocation”
Reviews.Author: yossiavgay
Reviews.Content: Although reserved a week ahead of time and marked that i require non smoking room. Got smoking room from the machine, yes you check in with a computer... and when complained they stated that they do not have any other rooms available. Changed me to a diffrent room in the morning where the air condition did not work. Lobby is crouded and rest room are at floor 6, yes, no restroom at the meeting room which is noisy and above the lobby and not in the lobby. Worst business hotel in NY. I will not go there any more.

Reviews.Title: “A Gem in the heart of Manhattan!!!”
Reviews.Author: CATHYRT
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews about the very small lobby, I was a bit apprehensive about trying this hotel for my first visit to NYC. I was very pleasantly surprised at this unique boutique hotel. My room was on the 22nd floor, and I had requested a balcony (they only have 2 or 3). I generally do not like heights, however, the vantage point was incredible!!! Radio City Music Hall below, St. Patrick's Cathedral and across the street Rockefeller Center!! Unloading was not a problem, as there were spaces in front to accomodate. Due to the size of our SUV, we had to park on 50th Street at an outdoor lot for $40, but it was not far to walk back to the hotel, and it was a pleasant walk in Manhattan. The location surrounded us with all of NYC's best....everything close by...The room, although small, was cozy, upscale, trendy and very "boutiquish." Yes the lobby is small, but unless you are spending the night in there, this is a "Must Stay"...Restaurant, business center, all the amenities are there. Ask for room 2201 with a balcony, you won't be disappointed!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Rach_8
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for six nights over New Year and were very impressed with this hotel. The location of the hotel was excellent, it is across the road from Rockefeller Plaza and half a block from 5th Avenue. Check in was very quick and the staff very helpful. The room was very clean and comfortable and was average size for NYC. There was a fridge and microwave in the room and bottled water was available to collect from every other floor in the hotel. The bathroom was on the small side but on our experience of staying in NYC before the rooms are generally small. Computers and printers are available in the hotel. We found the staff at the hotel very helpful. The only negative point of the hotel was the lift, there were two lifts in the hotel but the wait could be quite lengthy. There were stairs which a few people did walk up but our room was on the 19th floor so it would have been quite a walk. The hotel was excellent value for the price we paid. We would definately recommend this hotel for a stay in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Midtown Location”
Reviews.Author: turbojimmy
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I wanted to take a romantic getaway to see The Tree in Rockefeller Center. We only live an hour from NYC, so we've never booked a hotel there. This time, however, we wanted to have fun and not worry about the drive home. If you want to be close to Rockefeller Center, and all that it has to offer, there is no better location than the Rockefeller Center Hotel. From the 7th floor Terrace Club you could almost toss a rock and hit The Tree, the skating rink, St. Pat's Cathederal or Radio City Music hall. Like all Club Quarters, the place is very 'efficient'. It's all business, but it's efficient, clean, hospitable and neat. I figure we're going to see the sights, not to hang out in our hotel room. The room rate was about half that of the Hilton, which is a couple of blocks away, though still expensive since we visited after the tree was lit. Johnny Utah's, the restaurant in the basement of the hotel, was great, too. The food was so-so, but the atmosphere was fun, with a mechanical bull in the middle of the place and a packed house after 9:00PM. Bartenders were shockingly attentive and the wait staff was friendly and helpful. I'd definitely stay at the Rockefeller Center Hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: Killyc
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I are just back from a trip to NYC .We had an amazing time and there is much to see and do in this city . We stayed at the Rockefeller Centre Hotel and as the name would suggest this hotel is situated just off the Rockefeller Centre. It is also right beside Radio City Music Hall ,5th Auvenue, Broadway and Central Park.( All within easy walking distance) We could not have picked a better spot to start exploring this wonderful city. Like all NYC hotels the rooms are small however we found our room to be very clean and our bed was really comfortable . I have read other reviews about the bathroom but we had no complaints with same. It serves its purpose .The staff were friendly enough and we had no problems checking in or out. But you do need your key card for the elevator to take you to your room floor which is a bit of a nuisance if your like me and forget where youput it ! Im not sure what the story is with breakfast in this hotel as like most hotels in the US breakfast is not included and we just presumed it would be a bit of a rip off. Anyhow there are some great places to eat around the area. I would recommend this place for the perfect base to explore NYC

Reviews.Title: “Great spot for a 3 day visit”
Reviews.Author: Hampsteader
Reviews.Content: Before I review this hotel, I have to ask why this hotel is listed twice, uner two different names? This hotel and the Rockefeller Center Guest Quarters are one and the same. Read reviews for both - not sure why Trip Advisor doesn't amend the listing. I had a very nice stay here and for $179 plus taxes, don' t think I could have asked for better. I was there Monday-Wednesday, before Labor Day Weekend- so the very end of the summer season. I had a room on the 16th floor which was very quiet - execpt for the occasional middle of the night horn honking - but I don't think you can avoid that in NYC. My room was spacious, clean and well equipped. The bathroom was nice too, but as it has a sliding frosted glass door that doesn't really offer privacy (or shut tightly), I wouldn't have wanted to share the room with a friend. The location was great. (I wanted to stay in midtown because I was headed to both the Upper West Side and to meet friends in Brooklyn one night for dinner.) Being right on the egde of Rockefeller Center was also quite pleasant and handy. Lots of places to grab a decent breakfats for only a few dollars on your doorstep. There is a tube stop just round the corner next to Radio City Music Hall. (And for any homesick Brits, there is a Pret a Manger just a few blocks west.) This is not the place to stay if you want lots of service, a lobby bar, restaurant, etc. - none of which I was looking for. Not sure why some people complain about the tiny lobby (it is small) but who cares? There are some sofas in it if you need to wait for someone. The only thing on which I would give lower marks was service- and even then most of the people who work the front desk are polite and helpful (not necessarily friendly or welcoming, but polite). There was, however, one man whom I found extremely lacking in any sort of social graces and who does not belong working in a public capacity. I overlooked it but would not want to have to interact with him on a regular basis. It's a discredit to the hotel which seems to be otherwise very well run. I was a bit annoyed that I wasn't allowed to check in even a little early - the place was not full or even busy. I would recommend this hotel to single travellers or maybe a for couple in town for a few days. If I am entirely honest, though, I have this lingering feeling that I got "lucky" and had a good stay, whereas at a busier time of year or under other circumstances it might not have been as peaceful and pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: GoBadgers27
Reviews.Content: Great location and our room was surprisingly quiet even though it was in the center of Midtown. Just a few blocks from Times Square on one side and St Patricks Cathedral on 5th on the other side. Room was smaller than others I've stayed at in NYC but had flat screen TV and coffee maker. The shower in the bathroom was not separated from the rest of the floor so the whole floor was soaked after a shower, which I did not like. Lots of business people in the hotel - not much of a tourist hotel - no concierge to help us plan our time in NYC. Would recommend for location and value ($179 per night when booked and paid for in full in advance).

Reviews.Title: “Good location but nothing else”
Reviews.Author: GINDYGLASGOW
Reviews.Content: The room was small for 3 people and would only suit one person. The cushions and blanket had stains on them before we used them. The bathroom had a frosted door which reduced privacy and was small. The sofa bed and the main bed were comfortable to sleep in. The reception staff were not friendly and we were ignored throughout the whole stay. But the cleaning staff greeted us every morning. I would not go back to this hotel as their was nothing special but the location was good as many attractions are in easy access by walking. Lucky for us we were far too busy to spend time in the hotel as we were out all day exploring NY so for just sleeping in the room did its job.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent and would stay again”
Reviews.Author: ajhcaw
Reviews.Content: Small rooms but well designed and fantastic location. Very professional and friendly staff. Smart room, great bed and pillows - slept really well. Also, great to have free internet access with trust placed in guests not to over use. Would recommend that maps etc be placed in rooms. Only negative was that we could hear the generators so perhaps ask for a room away from these. One recommendation for any hotel, wish a hotel would just offer muesli or special K with low fat milk and a coffee or toast and coffee for a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “FABULOUS!”
Reviews.Author: ajmullin
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights and we had nothing but a fabulous experience. The location was perfect - right between 5th Ave, Radio City Music Hall and the Rockefeller Centre! Only a 2 min walk away from Time Square and a 2 min walk away from Central Park. It was perfect! The hotel staff were excellent - top notch service. They were very helpful in helping us find great places to eat and were always at the front door to make you feel welcomed and safe. They were always smiling! It was great! I don't have one bad thing to say about our stay! Our room was of course small - but I knew that going in as I paid the price for a cheaper room. However, it wasn't that small that we felt crampt. I highly recommend this hidden gem!!

Reviews.Title: “A very lovely surprise”
Reviews.Author: h1012
Reviews.Content: Sorry this is a very late review. I visited New York in May 2008 and it has to be one of the best places in the world. There are hundreds of hotels to choose from in NYC and this is a very lovely surprise. It is located just opposite the Rockefeller centre and is accessible to all of new york as there is a tube station across the road at the Rockefeller Centre. The rooms are a little dark but that's good for sleeping but they are very comfy and clean. The rooms are cleaned each day and the staff at reception are very helpful. If you fancy going to a Braodway show they are more than happy to book the tickets for you and give you ideas what to do although you will not be bored in NYC. There is internet access on the mezzanine floor but you may have to wait a sthere are only tow computers. Breakfast wasn't included but there are plenty of cafe's around to eat so there are no worries there. There is also a restaurant in the hotel but NYC is full of fab places so venture out. Gordon ramsey's Restaurant The London is a couple of blocks away and is a short walk and definitely worth a visit.

Reviews.Title: “Best choice, value, position!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: sweetiecherry
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through Expedia.it for an average of 100 $ a night and it's awesome!!! I mean it's not a luxury hotel, but spotless clean, in front of the Rockefeller center, near to the theater district, you have complimantary internet access and desktop at the mezzanine floor. For that price in NY I think it's really a great choice. Could be better: the reception is small and nearly always overcrowded, but they quickly attend your needs anyway, The desktop they provide id only one, but generally nobody is there (plus they provide a printer). The rooms are not big (they have mostly queen beds I think) but they have LCD TVs and anything you may need. If you are on the lowest floors it can be a little noisy, but if you get a room with a view on the inner yard, it is ok.

Reviews.Title: “A Winner!”
Reviews.Author: basingstokecambridge
Reviews.Content: Just returned from our 2nd stay at this hotel and once again, everything was outstanding. As others have pointed out, the location can`t be surpassed. Some have griped about the tiny lobby, but this is a triviality. Upon entering the hotel there are 2 check in/check out kiosks. You swipe your credit card, your reservation information comes up and it gives you your room key card. Very easy......no waiting in line. Elevator access requires the key card so security is a priority here. The youthful, smartly dressed staff is perpetually smiling and helpful. To appease those disgruntled souls who have issue with the lobby, the 7th floor Terrace Club more than compensates. There is a spacious sitting area, restaurant and gratis computers so you can check your personal email. As others have also mentioned, there are filtered water dispensers with bottles in the Terrace Club and on some other hotel floors. The hotel is only 3 years old and our room still looked new. We had a very comfortable queen bed, kitchenette, a great bathroom with a huge shower, flat screen televsion, comfortable sitting area with sofa bed and all the amenities of a much more expensive hotel. Requests for exptra pillows and an iron and ironing board were honored withing 5 minutes. We got all this for a great rate of $159 per night. We shall return!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Catmur
Reviews.Content: My husband and I celebrated our 1st anniversary in Manhattan and stayed at the hotel overnight. We were extremely pleased. Although we arrived several hours before check-in time, we were able to go to our room. The room was small but perfect for us. The furnishings were very nice and the bathroom was modern. We were on the 17th floor and had a fantastic view of St. Patrick's Cathedral. The location is convenient to everything but it's just a bit off the "beaten path" so it wasn't all that noisey. The staff was very efficient and friendly and the price was right ($166 with tax included). We'll definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: angnkvn
Reviews.Content: My husband & stayed here for two nights. We were very pleased with the hotel. We arrived about 12:30pm and was able to go ahead & check in. The room was very nice & modern. On every other floor they offered free filtered bottles of water. Room had a small refrigerator & microwave. Excellent location-was able to walk to alot of places. Would definitely stay here again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: cllg012
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Rockefeller Center Hotel for one night (December 28th) with my mother and 9 year old daughter. The hotel was easy to find and in a perfect location for all of the activities I had planned. Although we requested a room on a high floor so that my daughter could see the tree, we received a room on the 7th floor (which we did not dispute). The front desk staff was very helpful. offering us storage for our bags, helping us to check-in using the automatic kiosk, and calling a car service when it was time to go to the airport. The room was nice, we had a studio, with tiled shower, and good sized bathroom. Our room also had a pull out couch, coffee maker, and flat panel TV. We ate at the restaurant twice. The first time, we had appetizers and wine (on the heated outdoor deck) mid-afternoon. The next morning, we had the buffet breakfast ($11 for cold buffet and $16 for cold and hot- which I thought was reasonable, considering I paid $23 for a breakfast buffet at a similar hotel in Boston). From the deck, you are able to see an obstructed view of Rockefeller center and the side entrance to Radio City Music Hall. On the day of our departure, we skated in Rockefeller center and had lunch at American Girl Place. The hotel was very close to both places. I have stayed at several other hotels in New York (including the Marriott Marquis and Affinia Dumont), and although not as luxurious as some, it one offered the best combination of location and amenities. I would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: amrit56
Reviews.Content: This place was amazing. First off the location was amazing, right by the Rockefeller tree and everything else was just a short walk away. My girlfriend and I did not use a Taxi at all. Everything was extremely close we either walked or took the Metro. The service was great. Everything we requested was at our room within 2 minutes. The front-desk was extremely helpful and catered to any of our needs - with a smile. The rooms were a little small but were equipped very nicely with a Samsung LCD TV and the beds were extremely comfortable. The rooms were also very clean. We are already planning our next trip to the Big Apple and plan on staying here again. Great value and and amazing place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!!!!”
Reviews.Author: JTB9110
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel for a see the Christmas Tree at Rockefeller Center is exceptional. The room was nice; nothing exceptional. The lifts were a problem.....sometimes spent over 7 minutes waiting for one. My keycard got deactivated three times during a 2 night stay. If you don't want the cleaning staff to turn off your heat during the day you need to let the front desk know. The check in/out staff was courteous and professional. A great location for visiting the Saks light show, Rockefeller Center tree, and Grand Central light show.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at The Rockefeller Center”
Reviews.Author: Mabel-forever
Reviews.Content: I had booked this hotel after reading other reviews onTA. We arrived at the hotel at about 1.30pm but were immediately assisted by the desk staff and given the keys to our room. I had read about problems with the lifts at this hotel, but our cards worked straight away and all through our short stay we never waited more than a couple of minutes for a lift. Our room was 605 at the front of the hotel, overlooking W.51st and The Rockefeller Plaza ... well the entrance to it ! The room was perfect for us, twin beds, a sofa, desk, flat screen tv and a kitchen area with a fridge, microwave and coffee machine(which we used to brew our tea in each morning). Basic supplies are available from Duane Reade almost next door to the hotel and we took breakfast in a deli/coffee shop a couple of doors down the street, great value and lovely coffee. The beds were extemely comfy and we both slept well. The bathroom was small but very clean and well stocked with towels, the only complaint from us was that the water in the shower could have been a touch hotter. One night of our stay we had been to The Radio City Music Hall Christmas Spectacular and decided as it was extremely cold we would have room service. We chose to order from The Terrace Club, the hotel has a selection of restaurants to order from. Our meal and bottle of wine arrived promptly and was quite tasty . On our last day we requested a late check out, so kept our room until 3pm for an extra $35, this was useful and then our bags were kept for us until we left for the airport later that evening. On departure from the hotel we enquired about a cab, Member of staff on the desk asked if we would like her to order a car for us, a price of $60 was quoted, inc. tip & tolls . This sounded great.... she went off to arrange it and then said the car was right outside! Imagine our surprise when we went out to find a HUGE white stretch limo..... Same price ! So we travelled back to JFK in style! Good job too as it took forever! the traffic was awful. Would definately book this hotel again and recommend to fellow travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location with helpful staff!!”
Reviews.Author: ValerieMow
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Rockefeller hotel for 4 nights in July and got an excellent deal for four of use to stay in a studio type room - something like 660 pounds on expedia so we couldn't turn it down. Two people had to sleep on a sofa bed which wasn't the most comfortable but other than this the room was very spacious and comfortable. The hotel staff are very friendly and advised us on all the local attractions that are minutes away from the hotel. Timesquare is literally around the corner and there were no shortage of delis for breakfast and lunch - very affordable too!! We had a great time at this hotel and would definitely stay in it again because of its superb location, its facilities and its staff.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay at Rockefeller Center Hotel”
Reviews.Author: NellieHolly
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to NYC in early May for 4 days and 3 nights and decided to stay here. We had a lovely experience. The hotel is right in the heart of Rockefeller Center with easy walking access to Broadway, Central Park, Carnegie Hall and more. It is so convenient. The room, although small was quite nice and very clean. Color scheme was gray and maroon with bedding in dark gray...very business like. There really is no lobby...just a check-in desk and a few chairs. On the second floor front overlooking the lobby there is a small lounge with chairs, newspapers and a computer to access the internet. We had to park our car in a garage a few blocks away but we didn't mind. Another nice thing about this hotel was the excellent customer service of their young staff. Very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jill047
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 nights with my daughter at the Rockefeller Center. Really enjoyed our stay in this small and intimate hotel with only 6-8 rooms on each floor. Check in very efficient and given a room on the 6th floor. Found room to be rather dark and overlooking the back of the hotel so no view. Rang reception and asked for another room with a view - immediately given a room on the 16th floor overlooking Radio City Music Hall. Great room with all modern facilities. Yes, the rooms are rather small compared to the Novotel (which we normally stay in) but really they are only used to sleep in! The location for shopping couldn't be better only 1 block from 5th Ave and only 10-15 minutes from Times Sq, Central Park etc. Did have problems with the lift/elevator key not working properly on a number of occasions, but laughed it off - there is always someone to help! There is an attractive restaurant on the 7th floor overlooking the Rockefeller Plaza and St Patrick's Cathedral, only ate breakfast here once as found it quite expensive. Bonus of free bottled water available on every other floor. On our last day the premiere of 'Sex in the City' was taking place in Radio City Music Hall - pity we had to leave as we could have watched the celebrities arrive from our bedroom window! We will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: free2008
Reviews.Content: Hotel is perfectly located right in the heart of Manhattan. Front desk provided excellent service and suggestions for tours etc. Hotel is clean and room was more than adequate for two even though we booked a single and it was described as 'petite'. Cost of room was just over $300 a night which is apparently a good price for the location. Would definitely use this hotel again and recommend it anyone who wants to be central.

Reviews.Title: “Not enough for the price”
Reviews.Author: Traveling_NJ_Girl
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel because of its location. For its going rate, I expected a lot more. It is almost a pseudo-hotel. There is no real lobby (real small), just a couple places to sit and two self check-in kiosks that eject your room keys. There are a couple of concierge type people standing around but it was unclear to me their function. In regards to the room keys, they do not work immediately. After a failed first attempt of accessing my room, I was informed that it takes a few minutes for the card keys to work. The keys were recoded (just in case) and encountered a failed second attempt. With my luggage still in hand, I had to call maintenance, who did respond promptly, to access my room with their key. They informed me that a separate set of keys would be coded and delivered to the room. These keys never materialized, but fortunately the original (and recoded keys) started to work 10 minutes later. The room, located on the 5th floor, was small and included the bare minimum. The bathroom was also small and completely inadequate. The water pressure was terrible. The toilet would not properly flush and kept getting clogged. I had to call maintenance again to correct this problem. The bathroom had a stand-in shower with a curtain. This curtain did not do a very good job of maintaining the water in the shower. As I previously mentioned, water pressure was so low, you could not take a decent shower. This hotel is located next to Rockefeller Center, Fifth Avenue and very close to Central Park. If you are ONLY looking to be in this prime location, then this hotel may suit your needs (I would still suggest looking at others). BUT for its cost, I expect more from a hotel. Service was prompt when needed, but I should not need it so frequently for a single night stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great price, great service”
Reviews.Author: TravelCrew002
Reviews.Content: Booked on Expedia. Good rate for midtown Manhattan (booked 6 months prior; stayed between Christmas and New Years Eve) for studio room; family of 4. Small room, like most others in NYC, but fine for our purposes. Room was clean. Very helpful staff. Amazing location for seeing Radio City Christmas show, 5th Ave shopping, museums, plays, etc. We found our own restaurants, but did go with a concierge recommendation one night (Azalea's - Italian food) which was overpriced and not very authentic, compared to some smaller and nicer ones we found between 5th and Broadway. If you need to eat nearby, there's a good bakery a couple doors down (toward Ave of Americas) for breakfast. Another eatery a couple more doors down for good pizza. Concierge arranged for a car to EWR for us; very sharp black Lincoln for less than a taxi (which is what we took from EWR to hotel). Staff was nice and no problems with elevator, like I read about in a couple reviews. I'd go back with the fam.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location!!!”
Reviews.Author: siwesky
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Rockefeller Center Hotel for 5 nights over new year. Found it to be a very clean, comfortable hotel with a brilliant location! You could walk just about anywhere to the main attractions -5th Ave, Times Square, Empire State, Central Park etc etc. Being 1 block away from 5th Avenue shopping my girlfriend loved the convenience of being able to drop bags off into the hotel rather than having to carry them around all day! Check in and out was easy. All we did was swipe our credit card into a machine and it did everything for us - no need to line up at all for a check in person! The rooms were small - but most of them are in NY, but were vvere very cosy, very modern and clean. The bathroom was again clean and moden but had a shower cubicle and no bath. The lounge, bar and dining area was spacious, quiet and had lovely views out to the Rockefeller Center. It had 3 computers providing free internet access which was very handy. The only downsides to the hotel are that the lobby area is very small and can get crowded and they could do with more than 2 lifts! Be warned though this hotel has no car park!

Reviews.Title: “Fab time at the Rockefeller Center Hotel”
Reviews.Author: hipchick808
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Rockefeller Center Hotel during the busiest shopping week of the holiday season - 12/2 thru 12/7. We couldn't have been in a better location, we were literally steps away from 5th Avenue shopping and the Rockefeller Center Tree. CHECK IN: Fast and Efficient ROOM: LARGE compared to other NY hotels. The little kitchenette was great. Bed was comfortable. Closet was small, but still lots of room for our suitcases under the desk and in the seating area. ELEVATOR: Slower than other hotels, but manageable. MISC: Loved the free water, staff was friendly, couldn't have asked for a better location.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel, GREAT location”
Reviews.Author: Migma
Reviews.Content: yep, the previous reviews are correct... The rooms are on the small side, but the bathroom is exceptionally small. I really didn't like the fact that there was a sliding door to the bathroom that did not meet flush with the wall, leaving an open couple inches gap between door and wall. Our room was clean, though not meticulous by any means. The black furniture highlighted the dust. The bed, however, was heaven and the pillows were exceptional. The day staff were very friendly and helpful. The night staff, not so. So, the hotel is nice, not great, but the location is superb. So much that you want to do is within walking distance. For a better rate, I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Right Price, Right Location. Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: Nikerunner
Reviews.Content: First off, arrived at the location early morning. Knowing that check in is at 3pm, i was able to check in early. Great Start!! They have a great breakfast on thier "Club". Price was reasonable. The front desk staff were great, helped me make reservations at restaurants and also booked a helicoptor tour for me and my wife. Only thing i can say i wish they changed were the elevators. Building is between 25 to 30 floors. Yet only 2 elevators? I guess not something can be changed now. But overall the experience in new york was great along with location just made it even more special. Will definetly return and reccommend! A +++

Reviews.Title: “Great location, modern rooms, reasonable value for money”
Reviews.Author: locorocoworld
Reviews.Content: A reasonable price for modern, comfortable rooms in a great location right by the Rockefeller centre and 5th avenue - great if you're a shopaholic like me! There's no lobby really, so it is pretty much the lift to your room and that's about it - so it really depends what you expect from a hotel. If you just want a modern, clean, comfy room in the centre of Manhattan you will be fine, but don't expect fancy room service or anything like that! There are a couple of pretty affordable places to breakfast at just next to the hotel so don't worry that breakfast isn't included in the price - you can grab something for $5 or less in the cafes nearby. The room was a moderate size for NYC, but the good thing was that it was well designed so you felt you had more space. Good air con system. Modern furnishings and nice flat screen TV. Decent hairdryer and coffee maker provided, they also have vending machines for drinks.

Reviews.Title: “Great NYC Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AZtravelpeople
Reviews.Content: My fiancee and I stayed at the Rockefeller Center Hotel for 2 nights in July of 2007. When researching hotels for our trip, we had a few requirements that needed to be met: 1) reasonable rate (didn't want to spend more than $300/night), 2) mid-town location, 3) reasonable overnight parking rates (yes, some people still need to park a car in NYC), 4) exercise facilities and 5) internet access The Rockefeller Center Hotel met all of these requirements. The hotel was clean, modern, and efficient. The rate was very reasonable (our rate was $245/night) . The rooms were small, but nothing out of the usual for NYC. Two years ago we stayed at the Grand Hyatt NYC and I would rate the room quality an the Rockefeller Center Hotel roughly equivalent. The Grand Hyatt's rooms seemed to be a bit larger and it had a giant, fancy lobby (but how much time are you planning on spending in the lobby of your hotel in NYC in the summer?) High speed internet access was included at no additional fee. It has a decent exercise facility. A nice bonus was the free bottled water. If for some reason you have a car you need to park overnight (this doesn't apply to most people), the Rockefeller Center Hotel had an agreement with a garage a couple of blocks away for only $35 a night. Many other hotels we considered were closer to $50/night. Rockefeller Center is a great place to be if you're a tourist. It was fantastic to be able to get up in the morning and walk 2 minutes to watch the live broadcast of the Today Show. When we stayed there, the hotel appeared to be very new -- and as long as it's kept in good shape, we would definitely stay there again.

HotelInfo.Name: Manhattan Centre Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 25 West 51st Street #B, New York City, NY 10019
